definition:
large or great in dimensions, bulk, or extent                                      
             
             a big house

operating on a large scale                                      
             
             big government
capital sense 1

filled with or characterized by enthusiasm and interest                                      
             
             I'm a big fan of soy foods but urge you to choose them wisely.

expressed in an enthusiastic or unrestrained way : hearty                                      
             
             greeted me with a big hug

chief, preeminent                                      
             
             the big issue of the campaign

of great importance or significance                                      
             
             the big moment

magnanimous, generous                                      
             
             was big about it

outstandingly worthy or able                                      
             
             a truly big man

imposing, pretentious                                      
             
             using big words

more advanced in age : older                                      
             
             my big brother

popular                                      
             
             soft drinks are very big in Mexico

of great force                                      
             
             a big storm

of great strength                                      
             
             Sir Launcelot was big and strong again.
pregnant

full to bursting : swelling                                      
             
             big with rage
full and resonant

full-bodied and flavorful                                      
                
                  —used of wine
strongly favoring or liking

to a large amount or extent                                      
             
             won big

on a large scale                                      
             
             think big
in a loud or declamatory manner

hard                                      
             
             hits her forehand big
an individual or organization of outstanding importance or power

a big player : a center or forward whose large size and strength are used to control play near the basket                                      
             
             But, the problem is that you MUST have guards. You can't play five bigs.
large in size
large in number or amount
involving or including many people, things, etc.
in a big way
in a way that is meant to impress people

large in size                                      
             
             a big house

large in number or amount                                      
             
             a big group

of great importance                                      
             
             big news

of great strength or force                                      
             
             a big storm
in: a big house
a big fleet
big government

I'm not a big shopper, so for me to actually like a store is really saying something.
greeted me with a big hug
the big issue of the campaign
the big moment
was big about it
a truly big man
using big words
big talk
my big brother

soft drinks are very big in Mexico
a big storm

big with child
big with rage
she is big on blushing
won big
think big
talk big

playing in the bigs

a big glass of soda
She moved to a bigger city.
the biggest city in the state

She works for a big company.
He organized a big advertising campaign.
We had a big fund-raiser for the school.
He talks big about his plans, but he hasn't done much yet.
with that new promotion he's now one of the bigs in the company
when a candidate is running for president, he's playing in the bigs and cannot afford to make major mistakes
a big man
a big group
big news

definition: large in size
a big person is tall and heavy, and often fat
large in degree, or having a strong effect
very enthusiastic or serious about something
popular with many people
important or major
powerful or successful in a particular area of activity
used for referring to large and powerful industries that are considered to have a lot of political influence
a big boy or a big girl is getting older or is older than another child. This word is used mainly by children or when speaking to children
your big sister or big brother is older than you are
to become very successful
to be ambitious; to have plans to be famous and successful
the more power or success someone has, the harder it will be for them to lose it
used for saying that something is significant if it can be verified
in: a beautiful woman with big eyes
He kept all his secret papers in a big box.
great big  (=very big): At the end of the lane was a great big house.
A big man stood in the doorway.
The company faces big problems.
The concerts have been a big success.
They were big fans of the Beatles.
a type of music that is big in America
We have another big game next week.
I had never been involved in making the big decisions before.
Big changes are likely to be made.
The place was full of big businessmen.
big in: Her mother is big in daytime television.
the big two/three/four etc  (=the two/three/four etc most important people or organizations): Other stores struggle to compete with the big four retailers.
Big Tobacco  (=the major cigarette companies)
an important victory for Big Oil
Come on, you’re a big girl now  (=old enough to behave like an adult).
This is my big brother, Jake.
a big smile/kiss/hug etc
be big of someone (to do something)
be big on something
be too big for your boots
make a big thing (out) of something
what’s the big idea?

definition: large in size or amount:
older or more like an adult:
used to add emphasis:
important, because of being powerful, or having a lot of influence or a serious effect:
to be important or famous in a particular place or type of work:
If a product or activity is big, it is extremely popular:
Big can also mean to a large degree:
infml Big can also mean older:
infml Big can also be used to add emphasis:
important, because of being powerful, influential, or having a serious effect:
infml If a product or activity is big, it is extremely popular:
describing a bank that is so important to the economy of a country that the government will give it public money to prevent it from failing. This happened with many big banks between 2008-2009. :
